topic.title: Adding Images to a DITA Topic

body.p: There are four ways to add images to a DITA topic, depending on if you want to create a figure (with title and caption) or just insert an image inline, and on whether you want to use different versions of a graphic in different media. (For instance, you might want to use a raster format such as PNG for Web output but a vector format such as EPS for print output.)
body.note: You must use a graphic format that is supported by the DITA output transforms (either those provided by the DITA Open Toolkit, or by third parties). Not all output transforms may support all the same media types. Consult the DITA documentation for information on which formats are supported.

ol.li: Place the caret in the position you want the graphic to be inserted.
Click the Insert Image Reference button . The Choose image dialog appears.

Either type in the URL of the image you want to insert or choose one of the insertion options provided by the button to the right of the URL: field. The following insertion options are available, each of which will allow you to select an image to enter:
Browser for local file: Opens the Open dialog to select a local file.
Browse for remote file: Opens the Open URL dialog to select a remote file.
Browse for archived file: Opens the Archive Browser to select a file from an archive.
Browse Data Source Explorer: Open the Data Source Explorer to select a file from a connected data source.
Search for file: Opens the Find Resource dialog to search for a file.
